data.description:
Quindar builds modern, cloud-native satellite mission operations software, aiming to operate satellites like servers. They are seeking a Software Engineering Intern to help build and automate software tests and simulations to ensure the reliability of their mission operations platform.


Responsibilities

  • Build automated tests and representative satellite operations simulations under guidance from senior engineers
  • Contribute to test suites that verify critical platform behavior
  • Help debug issues discovered in tests or in deployed systems
  • Document findings and collaborate with engineers on fixes
  • Understand how key parts of the platform behave (e.g., task execution, APIs, distributed services)
  • Translate that understanding into effective test scenarios
  • Help maintain and improve test automation infrastructure
  • Work with CI/CD tools to ensure short and long-running tests run reliably and provide clear feedback to developers
  • Partner with backend engineers, product managers, and peers to learn requirements, validate functionality, and align on quality goals

Skills

  • Experience with Python and Typescript (in coursework, projects, or personal work)
  • Familiarity with automated or end-to-end testing tools (e.g., Playwright, Cypress)
  • Basic understanding of Git and version control workflows
  • Exposure to APIs, services, or cloud concepts
  • Curious and detail-orientedâ€”enjoys digging into how things work
  • Strong communicator; able to explain issues and ask good questions
  • Self-starter mindset; comfortable taking on tasks and learning independently
  • Enjoys collaboration across technical teams
  • Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Aerospace Engineering, or a related field
  • Academic or personal experience with software testing, backend systems, automation, or quality assurance
  • Interest in distributed systems, cloud software, or mission-critical platforms
  • To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State

Benefits

  • Strong emphasis on company culture and team wellbeing

Company Overview

  • Quindar offers a one-stop shop in the cloud for spacecraft analysis and operations. It was founded in 2022, and is headquartered in Washington, District of Columbia, USA, with a workforce of 11-50 employees. Its website is https://www.quindar.space/.
